hadiths.text: It was narrated from Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri that:The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "If one of you does not know whether he prayed three or four (rak'ahs), let him pray a rak'ah then prostrate twice after that when he is sitting. Then if he prayed five (rak'ahs), they (the two prostrations) will make his prayer even-numbered, and if he had prayed four, they will annoy and humiliate the shaitan

chapter.ara-name: باب إِتْمَامِ الْمُصَلِّي عَلَى مَا ذَكَرَ إِذَا شَكَّ
chapter.eng-name: The praying person completing (the prayer) upon what he remembers when he doubts
